intro: Uragoga carthagenensis, commonly known as the Carthage uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
